newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Ten pct allotment in EDP OPV possible.
newsitem.headline: Ten pct allotment in EDP OPV possible.

text.p: Investors in the public offer to sell (OPV) in the forthcoming privatisation of EDP-Electricidade de Portugal may receive some 10 percent of the shares they apply for, EDP President Antonio de Almeida said.

"We are four days into the pre-registration period. If demand continues at this pace, and if the publicity campaign draws in more Portuguese, I think a 10 percent figure is not unrealistic," Almeida said at the start of a roadshow to promote the sale.

But he said it was too early to make accurate forecasts of the total level of demand. "Much of the demand is driven by the fact that many people think they will receive a small proportion of the shares that they apply for," he said.

A banking source told Reuters on Thursday that applications had been submitted in the first three days of pre-registration for 642 million shares, representing more than four times the number of shares likely to be on offer.
